nodes.bodyText: in case useTryLock=false, lockBlock(long, long, BlockLockType, boolean useTryLock, long, unit)  requires some used time unit value. This is not a good way for an API. I would avoid convoluting two methods

@apc999 Sorry for not clarify the detail, I mean create a private method private void lockBlock(long, long, BlockLockType, boolean useTryLock, long, unit), so it's not an API, you can keep the two method lockBlock and tryLockBlock as the public method to be API for outer callee.
good call. I adopted what you suggested here. Thanks ! @maobaolong

Just a question:
When we meet this exception, we need more information to know what has happened, something like who(sessionId) hold this block write lock, how long has been held by this session? If user has already know there are something wrong with the session client, is there a way to let user/admin to clear the specific session's locks? So that, we don't have to wait the session timeout.

good call. I added more info.
Currently we don't have info like how long the lock is hold and whichelse sessions hold locks. That's why I mentioned today the LockInfo design might benefit Worker better than Master.
We also don't have ways to clean the session by admin. Might be a good thing to have.
@apc999 OK, @runzhiwang It seems your design can be useful.
